context.description: Use this page to select the Java bean from which you will create your Web service.

Enter the name of the Java bean to be used to create the Web service. Defaults the selected Java bean. Click Browse classes to view the bean class of the selected Java bean. The bean class is a model or template (an abstract data type) that can be instantiated to create objects with a common definition and therefore, common properties, operations, and behavior. Click Browse files to select a Java bean from the project.
Click to view the bean class of the selected Java bean.
Click this button to browse to a Java bean on your system to be used to create a Web service.
On this page you can select the name of the WSDL file that will be generated, and the methods that will be included in the Web service.
This field contains the unique identifier of the Web service. It is read-only.
This field contains the folder where the WSDL file will be generated. It is read-only.
This field contains the name of the WSDL file that will be generated. Accept the default or enter a new name.
Select from the available Java bean methods which ones to include in your Web service.
Click this button to include all listed methods in your Web service.
Click this button to remove all listed methods from your Web service.
Select this check box to customize the mappings between packages and namespaces.
Use this page to specify information about the Java bean skeleton being created.
This field lists the SOAP body namespace and unique identifier of the Web service being created.
This field lists the location of the WSDL file being generated.
Enter the name of the WSDL file being created, or accept the default.
Enter the location where the Java bean skeleton will be created, or accept the default.
Use this button to browse to the location where you want the Java bean skeleton to be created.
Select this check box to customize the mappings between packages and namespaces.
